page.title: 15MEDIA
page.content: Radio and television are the most popular ways of obtaining news & entertainment. Virtually all households have television, colour sets being on the increase. As well as BBC, local Independent TV programmes are transmitted from Norwich. Radio sets are mostly portable & frequently used outside the home. Tractors are often fitted with headphonesto reduce boredom when working in the very large fields in this area. There are broadcasts from local radio stations in Ipswich, Norwich and Bury St. Edmunds. The village shop supplies daily papers to most of the inhabitants, the local East Anglian Daily Times and the Eastern Daily Press being the most popular. Magazines are supplied to order ranging from Farmer's Weekly to women's books & children's comics.
